title: Static Men's Clothing Store Single-Page Landing

requirements.summary: Build a single-page static landing that displays the exact title, founder line, and both phone numbers with ordering instruction in English.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page renders the title exactly as “Men’s Clothing Store”.
Founder information is displayed exactly as “Founder: Yash Jaiswal”.
Main contact number is displayed exactly as “9919031636”.
Order contact instruction is displayed exactly as “Order Now: 9919031626”.
No backend calls are required to view the page content.

file_operations.description: Create the single-page React view containing the required English text exactly as specified (title, founder, contact, order instruction) and static informational sections. Use shadcn/ui composition (e.g., Card/Separator/Button variants where appropriate) for consistent layout and styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure the app renders the static landing without requiring any authentication flow for viewing content (remove InternetIdentityProvider wrapping if it would prompt/login or otherwise gate rendering).
Keep document language and metadata aligned with an English static informational site (ensure lang stays 'en' and title is appropriate for the landing).

requirements.summary: Make both phone numbers tappable/clickable via tel: links with clear labels for general contact vs ordering.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking/tapping the main contact number opens the device dialer via a tel: link.
Clicking/tapping the order number opens the device dialer via a tel: link.
Labels/text make it clear which number is for general contact and which is for ordering.

file_operations.description: Render both numbers as distinct tel: links with explicit labels (general contact vs ordering). Use shadcn/ui Button (as link) and/or Card callouts to clearly separate the two actions; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Apply a coherent, modern fashion-forward theme (avoid blue/purple dominance) with responsive layout and emphasized contact/order callouts.
acceptanceCriteria: The page uses a consistent color palette and typography appropriate for a men’s fashion storefront (avoid blue/purple as dominant theme colors).
Layout is responsive and looks good on mobile and desktop.
Contact/order callouts are visually emphasized (e.g., cards or highlighted sections) without adding new product features.

file_operations.description: Add global Tailwind + theme token CSS (shadcn/ui variable-based colors) using a modern neutral palette (e.g., charcoal/black/ivory with metallic/gold accent) and consistent typography defaults; avoid blue/purple as dominant colors.
Adjust/extend Tailwind theme settings as needed to support the chosen modern fashion-forward palette and spacing/typography scale without introducing blue/purple as dominant theme colors.

Apply responsive layout structure (header/hero/sections) and visually emphasized contact/order callouts using shadcn/ui components (e.g., Card/Badge/Separator) and Tailwind utilities; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add and render the generated logo and hero banner images from frontend/public/assets/generated on the landing page.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are loaded directly by the React app (no backend/image API).
The logo image is displayed in the header/brand area.
The hero/banner image is displayed prominently near the top of the page.
Images render correctly in production build and on mobile/desktop.

file_operations.description: Add the generated static logo asset at the required path for direct loading by the React app.
Add the generated static hero/banner asset at the required path for direct loading by the React app.

Reference and render the static images from frontend/public/assets/generated/mens-clothing-logo.dim_512x512.png (header/brand area) and frontend/public/assets/generated/mens-clothing-hero.dim_1600x800.png (prominent hero near top). Use shadcn/ui layout composition for header/hero framing where helpful; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
